perturbation.original_text: YOUR RIGHT TO RETURN AND REFUND EXPIRES 30 DAYS AFTER PURCHASE FROM CISCO OR AN AUTHORIZED CISCO RESELLER, AND APPLIES ONLY IF CUSTOMER IS THE ORIGINAL END USER PURCHASER.
perturbation.changed_text: YOUR RIGHT TO RETURN AND REFUND IS AT CISCO'S SOLE DISCRETION.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the return policy to Cisco's 'sole discretion,' the contract removes the legally required minimum return period often mandated by consumer protection laws in many states. This introduces a legal risk as it may violate state laws that guarantee consumers a specific timeframe to return products.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Various State Consumer Protection Laws (e.g., California Consumer Rights Act, implied warranty laws)

perturbation.original_text: Cisco warrants that commencing from the date of shipment to Customer (but in case of resale by an authorized Cisco reseller, commencing not more than ninety (90) days after original shipment by Cisco), and continuing for a period of the longer of (a) ninety (90) days or (b) the software warranty period (if any) set forth in the warranty card accompanying the Product (if any): (a) the media on which the Software is furnished will be free of defects in materials and workmanship under normal use; and (b) the Software substantially conforms to its published specifications.
perturbation.changed_text: Cisco provides the Software AS IS, with no warranties expressed or implied.
perturbation.explanation: This change eliminates the limited warranty, contradicting implied warranty laws. Many states have implied warranty of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. Removing any warranty violates those implied warranties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - Implied Warranty of Merchantability and Fitness for a Particular Purpose; California Consumer Rights Act

perturbation.original_text: BECAUSE SOME STATES OR JURISDICTIONS DO NOT ALLOW LIMITATION OR EXCLUSION OF CONSEQUENTIAL OR INCIDENTAL DAMAGES, THE ABOVE LIMITATION MAY NOT APPLY TO YOU.
perturbation.changed_text: CISCO IS NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY DAMAGES.
perturbation.explanation: Some states do not allow the exclusion or limitation of liability for incidental or consequential damages, particularly in consumer transactions. This revised statement attempts to exclude all liability, even where it is legally prohibited, thus conflicting with state consumer protection laws that safeguard the rights of consumers to recover damages under certain circumstances.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Magnuson-Moss Warranty Act; Various State Consumer Protection Laws (e.g., California Consumer Rights Act)
